key.name: order
key.description: The order of the window buttons (e.g. :minimize,maximize,close). Colon splits the buttons into two groups that you can position separately.

key.name: theme
key.description: The name of the theme to use (must be one of the folders in [extensionPath]/themes).

key.name: pinch
key.description: Use custom button order or the pinch order settings from mutter/metacity. Use 'custom' to use the custom button order in the 'order' key, 'metacity' to use metacity's settings (/apps/metacity/general/button_layout), 'gnome-shell' to use GNOME-shell's settings (org.gnome.shell.overrides.button-layout == /desktop/gnome/shell/windows/button_layout).

key.name: do-metacity
key.description: Try to use the theme with the same name as the current metacity theme ('/apps/metacity/general/theme')

key.name: box-left
key.summary: Box to put left buttons in
key.description: 'left' : buttons placed in the left box (activities + window title button); 'right': buttons placed in the right box (status area); 'middle': buttons placed in the centre box (date/time, unless you have (e.g.) Frippery Move Clock extension, in which case the centre box is empty and in between the left and right boxes)

key.name: box-right
key.summary: Box to put right buttons in
key.description: 'left' : buttons placed in the left box (activities + window title button); 'right': buttons placed in the right box (status area); 'middle': buttons placed in the centre box (date/time, unless you have (e.g.) Frippery Move Clock extension, in which case the centre box is empty and in between the left and right boxes)

key.name: position-left
key.description: 1 means 'first item from the left', 2 means 'second item from the left', and so on. Use negative numbers to mean 'from the right' (-1 is 'first item from the right').

key.name: position-right
key.description: 1 means 'first item from the left', 2 means 'second item from the left', and so on. Use negative numbers to mean 'from the right' (-1 is 'first item from the right').

key.name: onlymax
key.description: Prioritise controlling windows which are maximized (pressing buttons will control the uppermost maximized window rather than the current active one).

key.name: hideonnomax
key.summary: Hide if there are no maximized windows
key.description: Hide the window buttons if there are no maximized windows to control. Only works if controling only maximized windows. Only has any effect is the 'onlymax' option is set.

key.name: show-buttons
key.description: When to show the window buttons. 'always': show them all the time. 'windows' (default): show them when there are windows (hide when there are no windows at all); 'windows-visible': show them when there are *visible* windows (hide when there are no non-maximized windows); 'current-window-maximized': show buttons only when the current window is maximized; 'any-window-maximized': show buttons when *any* window is maximized (and control the uppermost maximized window, whether or not that is the *current* active window!).
